file_content.text: Hmm. Looks like more samples of Needles's weaponized rakghoul disease. What should we do with them?
The general will want these samples.
We take them to Garza.
What do you think we should do?
Any suggestions?
Well, it can't hurt to take a few samples back so Research Division can take a look at them. I'm sure they'd appreciate it.
We'll take the samples back with us, then.
Good call.
No one should have a weapon this dangerous.
No--we should destroy them.
We need to make sure nobody uses this stuff ever again.
Destroy them.
I think Garza would want a sample of this stuff for Research Division. Are you sure you want to destroy it?
We can't take the chance of a weapon like this being used.
I'm sure.
Just do what I tell you and keep your mouth shut.
Don't question my orders.
It's your call, Lieutenant.
Let's get back to base. I've had about all of the fun I can take.
I don't like it, but I guess we should bring the samples back with us.
I suppose you're right.
Just be careful with those things.
I'd say it's about time we got out of here, Lieutenant. I'll follow your lead.
[This case contains the remaining samples of Needles's weaponized rakghoul disease. It has a small button on the side, marked "Emergency Destruct".]
[Take the samples]
[You remove the last samples of Needles's creation from the case.]
[Destroy the samples]
[The case hums and smokes slightly as everything inside is utterly vaporized.]
In my opinion, the brilliant scientists of the Republic Army Research Division should have the chance to examine the samples. They may actually discover a positive application.
Just be sure to handle the containers with caution, sir.
I'm ready to return to the Republic outpost as soon as you are, Lieutenant. Lead on.
The choice is yours, Lieutenant.
If I may say so, I believe it's time we headed back to the Republic outpost. I'll follow your lead.
If I may say so, these samples could be put to great use in the advanced labs of the Republic Army's Research Division. Is their destruction really the best choice?
I would advise caution, Lieutenant. That case appears to contain the last remaining samples of Needles's weaponized rakghoul disease. What do you intend to do with them?
